description:
This series of videos will provide you with the knowledge and skills to plan and administer a Microsoft SharePoint 2016 environment. You will learn how to deploy, administer, and troubleshoot your SharePoint environment. These videos also provide guidelines, best practices, and considerations that help you optimize your SharePoint deployment.

This is the first in a sequence of two courses for IT professionals and is aligned with the SharePoint 2016 IT Pro certification.
name: SharePoint 2016 - 70-339
subtitle: Planning and Administering SharePoint 2016

episodes.description: This series of videos covers the knowledge and skills needed to configure and manage a MicrosoftÂ® SharePoint Server 2016 environment. You will learn how to configure SharePoint Server 2016, as well as provide guidelines, best practices, and considerations that will help you optimize your SharePoint server deployment. These videos align with the first exam in the SharePoint Server 2016 certification.
episodes.title: Overview

episodes.description: In this episode, Mark and Mike talk about the structure and capabilities of a SharePoint 2016 environment. They also discuss the major changes for IT professionals in SharePoint 2016, including key components of a SharePoint deployment, new features in SharePoint 2016, and deployment options.
episodes.title: Introducing SharePoint 2016

episodes.description: In this episode, Mark and Mike describe how to gather business requirements, and the key elements of a successful information architecture project. They also explain how to structure information within a SharePoint 2016 deployment and make it easy to find and retrieve.
episodes.title: Designing an Information Architecture

episodes.description: In this episode, Mark and Mike discuss how to plan a logical architecture design for a SharePoint 2016 deployment. They talk about the importance of planning, and the importance of determining what the organization needs from a SharePoint deployment.
episodes.title: Designing a Logical Architecture

episodes.description: In this episode, Mark and Mike use some diagrams to help visualize the logical and physical deployment models used in a SharePoint 2016 deployment. They talk about the advantages of different architectures based on the organizations needs.
episodes.title: Logical and Physical Architecture

episodes.description: In this episode, Mark and Mike describe the physical design requirements for SharePoint 2016, and the physical components necessary to fulfill the physical architecture design. They also describe how to map a logical architecture design to a physical architecture design.
episodes.title: Designing a Physical Architecture

episodes.description: In this episode, Mark and Mike demonstrate installing SharePoint 2016. They go through the installation wizard, describing the different options available. Then they complete the initial farm configuration wizard to complete the installation process.
episodes.title: Installing SharePoint

episodes.description: In this episode, Mark and Mike begin their exploration of farm level settings. They look at managing servers and services, converting roles, and configuring email settings. They also look at alternate access management, enabling farm features and farm solutions.
episodes.title: Configuring Farm Settings

episodes.description: In this episode, Mark and Mike continue their exploration of farm level settings. They look at configuring privacy options, and monitoring options like health analyzer and timer jobs. Then they cover some of the security settings, like the farm administrators group, distribution groups, and web application policies.
episodes.title: Configuring Farm Settings Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Mark and Mike continue their exploration of farm level settings. They explore settings that deal with managed accounts, authentication providers and antivirus settings. They also look at blocked file types, web part security, and self-service site collections settings.
episodes.title: Configuring Farm Settings Part 3

episodes.description: In this episode, Mark and Mike continue their exploration of farm level settings. They begin by looking at Information Rights Management settings and backup and restore settings. They explore upgrade and migration settings, patch management settings and database management. They also look at general application settings.
episodes.title: Configuring Farm Settings Part 4

episodes.description: In this episode, Mark and Mike finish their exploration of farm level settings. They look at farm level search settings.
episodes.title: Configuring Farm Settings Part 5

episodes.description: In this episode, Mark and Mike discuss how to create web applications and site collections. They also look at the various setting used to configure a web application.
episodes.title: Creating Web Apps and Site Collections

episodes.description: In this episode, Mark and Mike discuss how to configure a site collection. They look at the various settings and options available for a site collection.
episodes.title: Configuring Site Collection

episodes.description: In this episode, Mark and Mike describe the service application architecture in SharePoint 2016. They demonstrate how to provision and manage service applications through the GUI and using PowerShell. They also demonstrate creating service application proxy groups.
episodes.title: Plan and Configure Service Applications

episodes.description: In this episode, Mark and Mike how configure authorization in SharePoint 2016. They create several groups in Active Directory and then create web application policies that grants permissions to those groups.
episodes.title: Managing Users and Permissions

episodes.description: In this episode, Mark and Mike discuss the SharePoint 2016 authentication infrastructure. They demonstrate how to configure claims, providers, and identity federation for SharePoint 2016. They also configure SharePoint to trust ADFS as an identity provider.
episodes.title: Configuring Federated Authentication

episodes.description: In this episode, Mark and Mike look at securing a SharePoint environment. They talk about the importance of securing the underlying OS platform. Then they demonstrate configuring farm-level security. They configure blocked file types, web part security, and implement security auditing.
episodes.title: Farm Level Security

episodes.description: In this episode, Mark and Mike explain how to create and manage content types and content type propagation. They demonstrate creating content types and publish content types across site collections. They also create term sets and terms, and configure the managed metadata service.
episodes.title: Managing Taxonomy

episodes.description: In this episode, Mark and Mike explain how to configure the User Profile service application, and manage user profiles and audiences. They also configure directory import and synchronization. Then they configure and provision My Sites.
episodes.title: Configuring User Profiles

episodes.description: In this episode, Mark and Mike discuss the Search service architecture, and how to configure the Search service in SharePoint. They demonstrate configuring Enterprise Search by configuring the Search service application and add a file share content source.
episodes.title: Configuring Enterprise Search

episodes.description: In this episode, Mark and Mike explain how to implement a monitoring plan for SharePoint 2016. They look at several reports that help identify and resolve problems. They also demonstrate investigating page load times by analyzing network traffic.
episodes.title: Monitoring a SharePoint 2016 Deployment

episodes.description: In this episode, Mark and Mike begin their exploration of SharePoint Online. They demonstrate creating a trial account, and look at the available options. They look at setting up a sandbox environment, as well as several resources available to help you get started with SharePoint   Online.
episodes.title: Introduction to SharePoint Online

episodes.description: In this episode, Mark and Mike continue their look at SharePoint Online, focusing on the SharePoint Online admin center. They demonstrate creating a site collection, and then explore various options to manage the site collection. They work with user profiles, managing audiences, and managing user permissions. They also look at managing My Sites in SharePoint Online.
episodes.title: Introduction to SharePoint Online Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Mark and Mike continue their exploration of the SharePoint Online admin center. They look at the BCS (business continuity service), and the term store. They also look at app settings, as well as configuring hybrid solutions.
episodes.title: Introduction to SharePoint Online Part 3

episodes.description: In this episode, Mark and Mike discuss configuring SharePoint Online search capabilities. They look at how to optimize search results by defining indexed fields, and promoting sites. They also look at creating search suggestions and managing result sources and query rules.
episodes.title: SharePoint Online Search Administration

episodes.description: In this episode, Mark and Mike take a look at integrating SharePoint Online with other online technologies. They start with OneDrive and Yammer, exploring different options available. Then they look at Delve, Sway and the Office Store.
episodes.title: SharePoint Online Integrated Technologies
